sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
An humble supplication to her Maiestie Southwell, Robert, Saint, 1561?-1595.
[1], 214, [1] leaves
English Secret Press], [England : Printed, anno Do. 1595 [i.e. 1600]
By Robert Southwell. Place of publication, press and actual publication date from STC. Although written by the end of 1591, the text is dated 1595. It was not printed until 1600--STC. Written in response to STC 8207: By the Queene. A declaration of great troubles pretended against the realme by a number of seminarie priests and Jesuits, sent, and very secretly dispersed in the same, to worke great treasons under a false pretence of religion, with a provision very necessary for remedy thereof. Formerly STC 7586. Identified as STC 7586 on UMI microfilm. Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
=======

Written in response to STC 8207: By the Queene. A declaration of great troubles pretended against the realme by a number of seminarie priests and Jesuits, sent, and very secretly dispersed in the same, to worke great treasons under a false pretence of religion, with a provision very necessary for remedy thereof.
